abstract.text: Gosky effect experiments hawe heen carried out on single-crystal a'-PdH. alloys with $0. 5 6 < x < 0. 7 4$ between 300 and 600 K using a capacitance method for strain measurements. From the temperature dependence of the reciprocal reluxation strength negative values for the spinodal temperature may be deduced in agreement with the predictions of a semirigid band model for the electronic band structure contribution to the total energy of the system. The long-range diffusion coefficients denved from the inelastic relaxation time show good consistency with results obtained by other workers in eomplementary temperature and/or concentration regimes. Arrhenius plots of the reduced or tracer diffusion coefficient lead to activation energies which are not more than 15% larger than the values found in dilute e phase PdH, alloys. The concentration dependence of the tracer diffusion varies more rapidly than $1-x$ . This deviation from a simple site-blocking model is an indication for the existence of H-H cooperative effects, involving a short-range repulsive interaction between the protons.

back_matter.text: This work was supported hy the Stichting vonr Fundamenteel Onder. zoek der Materie (FOM).
